Support From:

 

 
   Tune In: 88.5 FM & 1390 AM (Denver / Boulder) // 93.7 FM (Nederland) // Online Streams
 
Support Independent Community Radio
 KGNU is independent, non-commercial, community radio for Boulder, Denver and beyond. We depend on listener donations to keep the radio station running. Please make a donation now. Let us hear from you!
 
Spotlight: The Latest Updates from KGNU
On Air: Programming Notes
23rd Annual Charles Sawtelle Mountain Jam
 
Please join us for another fantastic day in the mountains with great food, friends and music. Slow-cooked, Texas-style barbecue, salads, homemade desserts and micro-brew beers accompany amazing music at the Gold Hill Inn. Our lineup this year includes Tim O'Brien, Open Road and Romano Paoletti. Look for ticket information late May!
 
Gold Hill Inn, Jul 24, starting at 11:30 AM
 
Schedule Changes
 
KGNU has made some changes to our schedule. We have added Al Jazeera Radio weekdays 5:30-6:00am. Smash It Back! brings a special mix of "Classic Punk & Other Junk" to the airwaves on Friday evenings from 11:00pm-Midnight starting June 3rd.
 
East Colfax Scratch Academy
 
The East Colfax Scratch Academy is a music education project of KGNU. We've been teaching the art of turntablism to students from East High School. The latest graduation performance at Twist & Shout for Spring students was featured on 9 News. More info and video.
 
KGNU Live on your iPhone or iPod Touch
 
You can now listen to KGNU live on your iPhone and iPod Touch with the Public Radio Player iPhone application. Get the app through the iTunes App Store or in the App Store on your iPhone. More info.
 
Federal Funding of Community Radio
 
Congress begins debating the 2012 federal budget this summer and some lawmakers are expected to again propose elimination of funding for public broadcasting.
 
Donate Your Old Car to Support KGNU
 
Donating your old vehicle is an easy way to support community radio. Avoid the hassle of selling it yourself, get a tax deduction and help KGNU!
 
Credit Union Membership and KGNU Visa® Platinum Credit Cards
 
You can support KGNU every time you use your Visa Platinum Credit Card. For a limited time only, a 4.9 % rate is available on balance transfers. Sign up for the new card through our longtime partner, the BME Federal Credit Union. All KGNU members are eligible to join this not-for-profit financial institution.
